intro: Lysimachia paridiformis var. paridiformis, commonly known as the paridiform lichen, is a species of flowering plant in the family Primulaceae. It is characterized by its trailing growth habit and small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of bright yellow flowers, which are typically borne on slender stalks. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, such as woodland floors or rocky crevices. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important component of its native habitats.
